remark.ch:
1.非同步遠距教學，須先修校內外生物化學相關課程。
2.上課時間為113年1月8日-3月29日，學生成績計入112學年度第2學期，修習通過之學生將獲得加州大學授課教師之簽名證明函

goal.en: Promote students to understand the epigenetic knowledge and to have the ability of leaning from English environment of US university.
goal.ch: 促進國際交流提升本校美國大學知名度，也可提升本校學生前沿生化領域修課多樣性，同時讓中大學生了解美國頂尖學府教學方式且能有效提升學生英文聽力與書寫能力。

content.en: Drug DesignOverview of how to identify and optimize drugs against a validated biological target (e.g., a protein like HIV protease). Students should have completed a course in Biochemistry (or please contact me). Graduate students are exempt. Each student will generate their own drug design project and poster. There is no text for the course; we will make use of primary research papers, taped lectures, online homework assignments, and zoom sessions to discuss any problems.What are the major reasons for the failure of drugs in clinical trials?How to exploit drug metabolism in drug design.How to use drug delivery to enhance therapeutic index.How to use informatics to screen real and virtual librariesHow to dock candidate inhibitors into target binding sites1 Introduction2 Target Validation3 Reversible and irreversible enzyme inhibition4 Quantitative structure-function relationships5 Pharmacokinetics6 Combinatorial libraries, high throughput screening7 Guest speakers from biotechnology and drug companies8 Combinatorial libraries, high throughput screening9 Midterm10 Proteins as therapeutics11 Chem-informatics12 Medicinal chemistry (SBDD, etc.)13 Toxicology14 Drug metabolism15 Pharmacogenetics/epigenetics16 Patent law17 Nucleic acids as therapeutics18 Final

textbook.ch: 每週均有期刊論文與輔助教材閱讀

grading.en: Part of your grade comes from your answering questions based on the five seminars listed below, all on topics of high relevance to this course. Dr. Mike Varney, Head Genentech Research and early development “Discovery and Development of GDC-0032: A Mutant Selective, Beta-Sparing PI3K Inhibitor” Prof. Michelle Arkin, UCSF School of Pharmacy, drug discovery “Inhibiting Protein-Protein Interactions: projections and reflections” Dr. Stacie Canan, Celgene, Executive Director Global Health Division Dr. Dan Shoemaker, Chief Science Officer, Fate Therapeutics “Using Small Molecules to Generate Programmed Cellular Immunotherapies for Fighting Cancer” Dr. Siegfried Reich, Senior VP Research, eFFECTOR Therapeutics

en.competency: Be equipped with expertise in specific research disciplines.
Be capable of planning and performing research activity and summarizing results in a published form in the end.
Be initiative to interact with others with different backgrounds and coordinate effort to overcome obstacles.
Be able to communicate with foreigners effectively.
Be self-driven constantly to explore science.

ch.competency: 具備研究領域之專業知識
可規劃並執行專題研究，並將成果撰寫成論文發表
與不同研究領域人員協調以解決化學課題
具足夠的外語能力可有效的與外籍人士溝通
自我鞭策不斷學習新知識
